data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
No matter what instructions you are sent up, you always face forward. If you face your way, you never go backward. So, the answer is no.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take 4 steps and turn around and turn right. Thus, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn back and take 4 steps. When you are circling your starting point, take 10 steps. It’ s because you have returned to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

A person makes 1 step towards the starting point and returns to it. In the first question you make 7 steps and this is the first step to return to the starting point. The second question states that you take 7 steps and this is the first step to turn left. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn left. Turn left. Take 9 steps. Take 3 steps. Take 3 steps. Turn around. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn left is the previous instruction to turn left and is repeated here. Take 3 steps is the previous instructions to turn around and is repeated here on step 7. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn left. Turn right. Take 7 steps. Turn around. Take 7 steps. Turn right. Turn left. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

In the first step you turn around and turn around and turn around. After the second turn, you turn around and turn around and turn around. The first turn is to direct you to turn around and turn around. The second turn is to direct you to turn right. So, the answer is no.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn right. Turn right. Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The starting point is located one step away, so the whole sequence of steps would come back to you from your starting point. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Turn around. Take 8 steps. Take 2 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn around takes 8 steps, and take 2 steps makes it more complicated. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step left. Take 4 steps forward. Take 6 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Before you can take a step in any direction, you must first take 3 steps. The starting point must be the one you are facing. There are a hundred things you cannot take back to the starting point. If you always face forward, you can take 1 step left. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 3 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn around. Take 2 steps. Take 7 steps. Take 3 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The first statement is the shortest. The second sentence shows how far you have to go to get to the starting point. So, the answer is No.

Take the 1st step backward if you are already facing forward. You can not take any step backward if you are facing immediately forward. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps backward. Take 8 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 5 steps left. Take 2 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you always face forward, you can always take 6 steps backward. Let’ s say you take 8 steps right, and the next step is 6 steps backward and 1 step backward. Similarly, if you always face forward and have 6 steps backward, you can always take 8 steps right. Similarly, if you always face forward and have 6 steps backward, you can always take 5 steps left and 2 steps left. If you always face forward and have 6 steps backward, you can always take 5 steps left and 2 steps left. When you are looking forward from the starting point, you always look forward. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps left. Take 3 steps left. Take 1 step left. Take 3 steps backward. Take 6 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 4 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Take 15 steps back, you'll squat in front of the wall because you're facing up. Take 9 steps left, you'll squat in front of the wall because you're facing down. Take 3 steps left, you squat in front of the wall, because you're facing down. Take 10 steps left, you squat in front of the wall because you are facing up. At the start, you take 2 steps forward, because you facing up, and then you take 3 steps. At the end, you take 4 steps right, because you are facing down. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 4 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 1 step right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You always face forward when you are walking. Sometimes you may get lost or have an imaginary space in front of your face. Sometimes you may get back on your left foot. So, the answer is no.

One takes 3 steps backwards, then 6 steps left, and one takes 3 steps right, then 3 steps right, and one takes one step forward. If you are facing forward, the directions will always have you facing forward. So, the answer is yes.

Turn around and turn right. Turn around and turn left. 4 steps + 10 steps = 21 steps. 8 steps + 8 steps = 24 steps. Thus, the answer is No.

A person cannot go backwards after facing forward. If someone faces away from the starting point, they can not return to the starting point without taking 5 steps backwards. Thus, the answer is No.

In the first step you should always face forward. In the second step you should always face left. Remember: the first step, the first step back, the first step right should always face left. So, the answer is Yes.

There are 9 steps from beginning to end. Each stage of a series will take one step and return - it is the order they go in. So, the answer is Yes.

Before changing a direction you should always face forward in all directions. The only thing you can do when facing equal directions is to still face forward and always face forward. Walking with right feet you could say you were walking right with 4 feet right, and now you are walking with 4 degrees left. You would have to walk 3 degrees side to side but not side to side without taking 3 degrees. Thus, the answer is Yes.

If you are facing forward and facing left, then going backward is the same as going forward. This means that to go backward, you start face downward and to go forward, you start facing forward. So, the answer is no.

Backward takes you back to the beginning point. Forward takes you forward. When you return to the starting point, you are facing backward. So, the answer is no.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 7 steps backward. Take 10 steps right. Take 4 steps forward. Take 1 step left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

The first step is always forward. The second step backward means that you are facing left. The third step forward means that you are facing the direction that you walked in the first one. Doing the first step backward leaves you with 10 steps back and the second step forward leaves you with 4 steps forward. Then, you take the second step left and the third step forward leaves you with 1 step left. So, the answer is Yes.
